enWisdom: Humility is the fruit of knowledge
Humility is the symbol of nobility
Humility spreads [one’s] virtue
Humility is the alms-tax of honour
Humility is the most honourable eminence
Humility is one of the snares [for capturing] of honour
umility is the more superior of the two honours

Wisdom: التَّوَاضُعُ مَعَ الرِّفْعَةِ كَالْعَفْوِ مَعَ الْقُدْرَةِ
enWisdom: Humility in spite of [having a] high rank is like forgiveness in spite of [possessing the] power [to punish]

Wisdom: التَّوَاضُعُ رَأْسُ الْعَقْلِ وَالتَّكَبُّرُ رَأْسُ الْجَهْلِ
enWisdom: Humility is the cornerstone of intelligence and pride is the cornerstone of ignorance

Wisdom: ارْفَعْ ثَوْبَكَ فَإِنَّهُ أَنْقَى [أَتْقَى‏] لَكَ وَأَتْقَى [أَنْقَى‏] لِقَلْبِكَ وَأَبْقَى عَلَيْكَ
enWisdom: Raise your garment (iedo not let it be too long) for that is purer for you, safer for your heart and more long-lasting on you

Wisdom: الْزَمُوا الْأَرْضَ وَاصْبِرُوا عَلَى الْبَلَاءِ وَلَا تَحَرَّكُوا بِأَيْدِيكُمْ وَهَوَى أَلْسِنَتِكُمْ
enWisdom: Stick to the earth, be patient in trials, and do not move your hands and follow the fancy of your tongues [in order to start quarrels]
The greatest honour is humility
The loftiest of people is the one who humbles himself

Wisdom: أَشْرَفُ الْخَلَائِقِ التَّوَاضُعُ وَالْحِلْمُ وَلِينُ الْجَانِبِ
enWisdom: The most honourable of attributes is humility, forbearance and affability

Wisdom: إِذَا أَرَدْتَ أَنْ تَعْظُمَ مَحَاسِنُكَ عِنْدَ النَّاسِ فَلَا تَعْظُمْ فِي عَيْنِكَ
enWisdom: When you wish your merits to be glorified among the people, then do not glorify yourself
The completeness of honour is [in] humility

Wisdom: تَوَاضَعُوا لِمَنْ تَتَعَلَّمُوا مِنْهُ الْعِلْمَ وَلِمَنْ تُعَلِّمُونَهُ وَلَا تَكُونُوا مِنْ جَبَابِرَةِ الْعُلَمَاءِ فَلَا يَقُومُ جَهْلُكُمْ بِعِلْمِكُمْ
enWisdom: Be humble in front of the one from whom you gain knowledge and the one whom you teach; and do not be from among the haughty scholars, lest your ignorance rises alongside you knowledge
Humility is the ladder of honour
The ladder of honour is humility and generosity
Counter arrogance with humility
Humility suffices as an honour

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ فَضِيلَةً أَنْ يُنَقِّصَ نَفْسَهُ
enWisdom: It suffices as a merit for a man to humble himself

Wisdom: مَنْ كَانَ مُتَوَاضِعاً لَمْ يَعْدَمِ الشَّرَفَ
enWisdom: One who is humble is never bereft of honour
None considers himself to be imperfect [and disparages his carnal soul] but the perfect one
None abases his [carnal] soul but the intelligent one
None is humble except the lofty

Wisdom: وَجِيهُ النَّاسِ مَنْ تَوَاضَعَ مَعَ رِفْعَةٍ وَذَلَّ مَعَ مَنَعَةٍ
enWisdom: The most eminent person is one who is humble despite his high standing and who shows humility despite his might

Wisdom: لَا تُسْرِعَنَّ إِلَى أَرْفَعِ مَوْضِعٍ فِي الْمَجْلِسِ فَإِنَّ الْمَوْضِعَ الَّذِي تُرْفَعُ إِلَيْهِ خَيْرٌ مِنَ الْمَوْضِعِ الَّذِي تُحَطُّ عَنْهُ
enWisdom: Do not rush to [occupy] the highest place in a gathering, for indeed the position that you are raised to is better than the position that you are lowered from
There is no honour like humility
